description:
Continuing our series on JS frameworks, this month the amazing CJ Reynolds will be walking us through Vue. CJ will give an overvue of the framework including vue-cli, directives, components, event handling and vue router. You'll walk away from this talk with the resources to get started on your first application with Vue.js.

CJ is an Educator, Maker and Full Stack Developer. Currently, he is a Lead Full Stack Developer at 303 software. CJ is a co-organizer of the Denver Vue.js Meetup and creator of the YouTube channel Coding Garden with CJ.

GitHub: https://github.com/w3cj
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLNgu_OupwoeESgtab33CCw

6:30 - 7:00 - Networking and socializing
7:00 - 8:00 - Presentation
8:00 - 8:30 - More networking and socializing

The always generous Code Talent (www.code-talent.com) will be providing the space and the beer. Hope to see you there.
name: OverVue of Vue (JS Frameworks Series)

description:
If you can't make it to Salt Lake City for NG-Conf this year, do the next best thing! Join us for NG-Conf Extended, a free live-stream viewing experience at the BrieBug office in Lakewood!

We will have the live-stream up on the projector screen all day, every day the conference is taking place. Lunch, snacks, and beverages will be provided by BrieBug. You are welcome to come to any or all of the days, and stay as long as you'd like. SPACE IS LIMITED, SO PLEASE RSVP FOR THE DAY YOU PLAN TO ATTEND, AND UPDATE IT AS NEEDED.

This free event will take place May 1st-3rd, during the hours of the conference:

Wednesday, May 1st - 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.
Thursday, May 2nd - 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.
Friday, May 3rd - 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Check out the link below for the NG-Conf workshop and talk schedule: https://www.ng-conf.org/schedule/
name: Day 3: NG-Conf Extended at BrieBug!

5:00 - Doors
5:30 - Food and Networking üçïüç∫
6:00 - üì£ Announcements üì£

Description:

May 1st through May 3rd, BrieBug will be in Salt Lake City as a platinum sponsor at NG-Conf! When we get back, we want to share what we learned with you. Jesse Sanders will be giving a recap on the conference!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bio:
Jesse Sanders is the founder/CEO of BrieBug Software and an Angular Google Developer Expert (GDE). He regularly speaks around the world on Angular and related web technologies to inform and inspire developers on how to build the next generation of web applications. He regularly teaches workshops on Angular fundamentals, NgRx, and advanced Angular topics. He specializes in architecting systems using Angular for enterprise clients to help them achieve their goals. When not working, he enjoys spending time with his children, biking, skiing/snowboarding, hiking, and training for triathlons. You can follow him on twitter ‚Äì @JesseS_BrieBug

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
name: NG-Conf Recap! - DTC

description:
Hello Designers & Friends,
The weather is finally warming up let's meet on the patio side of this favorite RiNo hang out for a few beers and games of cornholes.
There are food trucks and firepits to roast things as well.
Let's leave our screens behind and come enjoy this beautiful Spring weather.
https://www.yelp.com/biz/improper-city-denver

Zoe, Seth, Morgan and the rest of the gang.
name: HH on the Patio

description:
Come hang out with fellow members of the growing Denver/Boulder tech scene. Everyone is welcome. Come to learn, make contacts or discuss your latest project. No speaker, no agenda, no code knowledge necessary, just drinks.

Monthly Happy Hour. We are always open to suggestions for new venues to host the happy hour. Please feel free to message the us with any ideas.
how_to_find_us: We'll be upstairs on the patio and inside if needed
name: May Develop Happy Hour

description: TBD
name: RMA @ Crownpeak - Downtown

description:
Progress has no boundaries, and neither does R‚ÄãeactJS United‚Äã!! Milwaukee, Chicago and Pittsburgh are ecstatic ‚Äãto welcome React Denver as a presenting city for our 3rd ReactJS United event on May 21st.

We know it can be hard to get away and travel to all the conferences on your wish list! So, we have put together a crazy fantastic line-up of speakers that you wouldn't usually get to hear from your hometown, each with their unique take on React. The best part is all you have to do is attend your normal ReactJS Meetup!!

Learn, experience, and implement the knowledge you pick up from each presentation and don't forget to invite your friends!

All times are in Mountain Time.

5:00 - Informal Registration
5:30 - Milwaukee - "C‚Äãommitting to the power of SemVer" ‚Äãby J‚Äãosh Compton
6:00 - Chicago - "R‚Äãeact + Ethereum"‚Äã by ‚ÄãJustin Schuldt
6:30 - Denver -"Custom Redux Middleware‚Äù by Sharon Kong
with ‚ÄúSomething about Hooks‚Äù by Ryan Florence

Can't make it but want to connect virtually? Stay updated as we will be sharing a link for those who can't join in person.

Thank you to our React United sponsor, Northwestern Mutual who believes in removing the boundaries and offering FREE technology learning experiences.
how_to_find_us: We are on the corner of 17th and Market in the basement of the Guaranty Bank Building.
name: React United - Denver, Milwaukee, Chicago, & Pittsburgh!

description: TBD
name: RMA @ BrieBug - Lakewood

description: We will have 8 - 10 lightning talks (5 -10 minutes) on various subjects
how_to_find_us: We will have some folks from Ibotta to escort you up in the elevators.
name: Lightning Talks

description:
6:15pm: Intro and Whats going on in JavaScript Land? (20min)

We'll be talking about new/exciting things going on in the industry. If you have something you think we should mention, feel free to tweet us @DenverScript (https://twitter.com/denverscript).

6:35pm: Job Announcements

Anyone with a job opening can come up to the front and announce it to the group.

6:45pm: Shorter Presentation(8 - 10min):

How TurboFan Works: Optimizing JavaScript at Run-Time - Steve Kinney

A quick exploration of how Ignition and TurboFan take the code you wrote and optimize it for peek performance along with some common things you can do to not interfere with this process.

Steve is a senior principal engineer at Twilio SendGrid and an organizer of DinosaurJS.

7pm: Longer Presentation(20 - 30min):

React to React Native: How Hard Could It Be? - Kylie Stewart

So you know React, and now you want to build mobile interfaces for the same users. React Native shouldn't be too hard to ramp up with, given your existing React knowledge... right? You might be surprised to hear there are a few hurdles you'll need to jump through to get up and running.

Kylie Stewart is a software engineer and open source maintainer at Formidable. When she isn't behind a screen, Kylie spends her time climbing and hiking Colorado with her dog, Otis.

Socialize:

We'll have beer and pizza! We'll also allow people to announce any job opportunities they may have at that time so you can socialize with potential applicants.
name: Monthly DenverScript Meetup

description:
Hello Fellow Designers,

It's hot in the Summer in the City. Let's go grab some drinks at our favorite local Summer Spot, Ratio Beerworks!
Bring your best boardshorts, doggies, and sunnies. See you on the Patio.

Cheers,
Zoe, Seth, Morgan, and gang.
how_to_find_us: Designer looking folks.  JK, we'll have signs on growlers on two tables outside.
name: Summer HH

description:
Do you assume your modern web framework has all the built in security protection you might need? Think again. Cross-site scripting (XSS) and SQL injection are still common in today‚Äôs web applications. Join us for a discussion of the OWASP Top 10 and live demos of exploits using the OWASP Juice Shop modern web application.

‚Ä¢ What we'll do
5:30-6:30 Meet and Greet / Dinner (Pizza and Drinks Provided)
6:30-8:00 Main Topic Discussion
8:00-9:00 Mingle

‚Ä¢ What we‚Äôll cover
Let's break a web app and learn about security

* Livestream
To be announced

‚Ä¢ What to bring
Yourself, a friend, and some excitement to learn!
how_to_find_us: Take the elevator up to the 8th floor.
name: A Scripting Attack Walks Into a Web App

description: Details will be revealed soon! JAMstack Denver is hosted at Code Talent. You can find us at 3412 Blake Street from 6ish to 8ish on the first Wednesdays of each month. Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station. Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct

description:

HTML: accessibility, semantic markup CSS: new techniques, tools like PostCSS & Sass JS: vanilla JS, browser APIs Design: UX, UI, pattern libraries, animation Performance: image optimization, SVG, refactoring
